Key Match Events: Roston Chase’s unbeaten 42 off 27 balls (four fours, two sixes) led West Indies to victory.
Roston Chase and Andre Russell’s unbroken sixth-wicket partnership of 40 runs off just three overs.
Sese Bau’s belligerent 50 off 43 balls (six fours, one six) was the only meaningful contribution from PNG.
Alzarri Joseph and Andre Russell each took two wickets for West Indies.
Post-Match Reflections: Roston Chase reflected on his strategy to give himself time and back his skills to get the ball away.
PNG captain Assad Vala reflected on being 10-15 runs short of a more competitive target but was happy with the fight shown by his team.
West Indies captain Rovman Powell acknowledged the need for improvement in all three departments of the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: West Indies stuttered and stumbled before eventually scrambling a five-wicket win with an over to spare.
This was PNG’s second appearance in a world tournament, having lost all three matches in their debut appearance at the 2021 T20 World Cup.
